chapter.title: High Availability
chapter.para: Several aspects of a Quantum deployment benefit from high-availabilty to withstand individual node failures. In general, quantum-server and quantum-dhcp-agent can be run in an active-active fashion. quantum-l3-agent can be run only as active/passive, to avoid IP conflicts with respect to gateway IP addresses.

section.title: Quantum High Availability with Pacemaker
section.para: You can run some Quantum services into a cluster (Active / Passive or Active / Active for Quantum Server only) with Pacemaker.

Here you can download the latest Resources Agents :
quantum-server: https://github.com/madkiss/openstack-resource-agents/blob/master/ocf/quantum-server
quantum-dhcp-agent : https://github.com/madkiss/openstack-resource-agents/blob/master/ocf/quantum-agent-dhcp
quantum-l3-agent : https://github.com/madkiss/openstack-resource-agents/blob/master/ocf/quantum-agent-l3

db:note.db:para: If you need more informations about "How to build a cluster", please refer to Pacemaker documentation.
